subject: Good day,
body:
Good day,
I hope my email finds you well.
I work with a private Cybercrime security firm which liaises globally
with Financial institutions, entities and agencies that collaborate
through exchange of information to dictate and deter online Cybercrime
activities and other Financial crime related activities perpetrated
through banking transactions, cryptocurrency trades etc. Through
established policies, procedures, and processes, we are able to review
financial transactions and transaction parties (example, Fund
beneficiary, issuing bank(s), payee, endorser, or jurisdiction).
Apart from reporting these crimes to Government and its agencies who
does little or nothing to assist victims because government spends its
own resources (money) in creating and raising global awareness of this
trends, there has been a great window of opportunity that has been
created through a foremost fraud investigative agency that specializes
in block chain forensics, data science, transaction tracking and
cryptocurrency recovery. This agency also assists victims of all kinds
of online scams, Investment Loan schemes and other forms of Financial
crimes through the internet and other means to track, recover and refund
back their lost funds.
If you are interested in using the agency for your recovery then respond
to Shaimaa Morsy with this email, 
jchennager539@gmail.com
 , and provide
your mobile/cell number where she can reach you; she will create your
recovery claim profile, send you a reference number with the agencyâ€™s
information and the website to enable you to make your decision going
forward.
Have a good day.
Best Regards
James Craig Hennager

subject: Re: Good day,
body:
Hello James Craig Hennager,

Thank you for your email and the work you do sounds fascinating. I'm intrigued by the concept of cybercrime security and how it can help deter online financial crimes. 

I'm curious, could you tell me more about how this process works? How does your agency track and recover lost funds? Also, what kind of success rate does your agency have in recovering these funds?

Looking forward to hearing from you.

Best wishes,
Gerald
